name: The Waterloo Hotel

reviews.text: OK, so I stayed here overnight on a business trip on 20th Nov 07.
reviews.title: Lacking in many departments

likes.disliked: — The prices, the rooms, bathroom, lack of food.

reviews.text: The taxi ride from the station at night took little over 10 minutes and cost £10. Check-in was smooth and the American woman at reception was very friendly, arranged my wake-up call and booked a taxi for me in the morning without any hassle. So far so good.
reviews.title: Battle of Waterloo

reviews.text: Now I was under the impression that this hotel has recently undergone a refurbishment programme.... but the refurbishment certainly hasn't got as far as the room I was staying in, thats for sure (room 112 for those that are curious). In fact I would say for 100% that my university halls were in better shape than this room. And that isnt even streching it. The room was very very small, I'll admit, yes it was a 'single room', but really, when do u actually end up getting a large single bed squeezed in a box room for £105 per night (full price £125)?
reviews.title: Great for business or room only stay.
Friendly hotel for business and pleasure
reviews.text: But don't get me started on the bathroom!!! Its measurements couldnt have been more than 1m x 2.5 meters... it was tiny! There was just a small shower, basin and toilet. But wait, the shower was just a shower basin, with a shower cutain and a very old (dare I say) grubby shower head... certainly not inviting. And the floor tiles... yellow and blue checked....well its best not to try and look at them.... ugly and dirty looking (I'm sure they were clean, just looked very dirty) Remember £105 a night!

I went to the bar after I threw my belonging in the room in search of some food... the bar serves food until 10pm. Well can you get food?... not for love nor money. In fact they didn't even have pasta!!!! Run out of pasta... not even I run out of pasta- ever- and I never seem to have food! So I go to choose another dish... no they don have that either. I go through practically the whole menu and out of the 15 dishes they have only 2.5 avaliable.... the half? Well I could have a steak burger without the burger bun fo £10!!! Anyway I ended up with that and a glass of wine at £5.35 a pop! Absolute rip off!!!! But I will say this, the bar and restuarant are very warm, cosy and inviting... this must be where the refurbishment is at!
reviews.title: Good deal..good hotel!
Good Hotel, a little out of Bracknell
reviews.text: The hotel is in Crowthorne which is a little bit out of Bracknell - an issue if you get caught up in the horrendous rush hour traffic in the morning. It is a good, standard, quality chain hotel with an atmospheric bar and restaurant. The rooms I have stayed in have always been of a high standard for this price, of a decent size and clean.

description: This Victorian building built in 1860 is in the village of Crowthorne, with easy access to the M3 and M4 motorways. The Brook Waterloo has an outdoor terrace, real log fires and its en suite rooms are modern and stylish. The hotel is 5 miles from Bracknell town center and close to the area's business parks. Legoland Windsor is 12 miles away. Hotel Rooms: 77.
